import React, {useState} from "react" import './ExpenseForm.css' function ExpenseForm(){ const []= useState('') const titleChangeHandler = (event)=>{ // console.log(event) //* like vanilla js event handler has default event object as parameter it also does here //* after console log event object we see that target has value which is = to input we can use that console.log(event.target.value) } return
{/* onChange works similar to onInput i.e. on every keystroke but also dropdowns so onChange is better */}
} export default ExpenseForm
